textos_fuente.text: Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. We are an independent nonprofit that relies on community support. Diamond Head Theatre recognizes the use of diacritical markings in the modern orthography of Hawaiian language. These markings may be omitted to give you the best experience with our website. 520 Makapuu Avenue Honolulu, Hawaii 96816 Box Office Hours: Monday through Friday 10 am to 4 pm Box Office: (808) 733-0274 Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Click Here to Email Us SIGN UP FOR E-NEWS Subscriber Login FOLLOW US © 2024 Diamond Head Theatre | All Rights Reserved | Privacy Policy | About Accessibility | Site created by Transcendence Pacific. Need Help? contact us Top Pages Home About us Blog Shop Privacy Policy Terms & Conditions Airgigs Reviews Get Started Find Pros Post a Project How it works FAQ Log In Sign Up Connect Facebook X Instagram Pinterest YouTube Linkedin × How it Works The Concept: A marketplace & community of recording, mixing and mastering professionals working on projects from their own studios. The Goal: To open up new possibilities for music production via online collaboration and a new income stream for sound designers, session musicians and audio engineers. And why do we think it's possible? "Virtual" collaboration is already happening all over the music world, and AirGigs is just a central platform where people can post gigs for their skills and talents. The Process: On AirGigs, sellers post gigs for music production services that they can deliver online. They set the terms, provide representative audio samples and specify what materials (rough mixes, session files, formats, etc) that they require from buyers. All communication and file exchange happens through the Airgigs system. Buyers can leave reviews of gigs they have purchased. The Finances: When a buyer purchases a gig, payment is made through PayPal. AirGigs holds payment until the gig has been completed and then Sellers pay between 8-15% commission based on seniority, bonuses and promotions. For more detail click here The Benefits: For sellers the benefit is obvious - we handle all the marketing and you make money doing what you're best at. Buyer's have the opportunity to browse offerings from amazingly talented people all over the world. × Awesome, You're all set! About Us — Vivid Band Sign In My Account Home Media Setlists The Band Packages Gallery FAQ Contact Sign In My Account Home Media Setlists The Band Packages Gallery FAQ Contact We Are Vivid Band VIVID IS THE GO-TO BAND for parties, weddings and corporate events.  We are a professionally managed, scalable and established event band. We have more great reviews, and a wealth of material for our customers to review. We genuinely love what we do and this is reflected in our fantastic performances across the UK and Europe. SO WHY BOOK WITH US? *SOUND QUALITY of the band is probably the most important thing to consider at your event and it often gets overlooked. However good the performers are, if the overall sound quality is poor, the vocals indecipherable and the distinction between the instruments non existent, it will be difficult to appreciate the music at all. Live sound will vary from the sound you listen to in promotional videos on your home / mobile devices, and different venues have different acoustic properties. We own and supply genuine industry grade equipment to all events and we have a qualified engineer band member to manage the sound setup. Sound and disco lighting production for events of up to 250 persons is included as standard with all our packages. Additional production is also available  (in-house and upon request). In addition to this, our 8-piece and above line-ups are all booked with an independent sound engineer. We own our own 9-seater tour bus so we are able to carry a good stock of spares and we can all travel to gigs together which is very healthy for the environment too! *OUR HUGE SONG REPERTOIRE of both classic and contemporary songs makes us a very appealing option to any potential client. We have also complied a collection of song medleys that form the basis of the repertoire that you can choose for your event (take a peak at the Setlists page for more details). Performance medleys give us the opportunity to perform many more songs than would otherwise be available to you within your performance period. We avoid unnecessary stops and starts between songs, and we maintain the momentum throughout the show. Modern music is heavily produced and we can recreate this with our genuine authentic reproductions using modern instruments and versatile effects units. *OUR EXPERIENCE is legendary. We have been trusted to perform at many high calibre events and for numerous high profile clients such as Mercedes UK, Shell Europe, R.A.F. Marriott Hotels, Guoman Hotels, The Natural History Museum, The Victoria & Albert Museum. Our singers have worked with producers such as Rodney Jerkins, Jimmy Harry, and Shelley Peikin, having contributed to original songs for artists such as Michael Jackson, Madonna, Beyonce, Whitney Houston, Ed Sheeran, and Kylie. *VIVID MUSICIANS AND VOCALISTS are a stellar collection of London's West End performers and industry professional musicians. All our singers are experienced West End show performers or have established, successful industry solo careers. All of our musicians are professional performers and all carry degrees from respected music schools.  We are all qualified in both jazz and pop disciplines. *ADDITIONAL SERVICE options are available to cover many other areas of your entertainment brief . We have 3 DJ selections as well as DJ sax live option. We provide instrumental and vocal-led acoustic / jazz band options, roaming bands, horn sections and multiple vocalist line-ups. We have additional production available for events over 250 persons and we can provide a mesmerising star cloth background to all clients. We can even supply a range of photo booths from our sister company Viivd Booths. *SAXOPHONE IS INCLUDED WITH ALL BOOKINGS. That’s right - whichever line up you choose, we provide a saxophonist as part of the band and to roam the dance floor if you wish! *CHOOSE YOUR LINE-UP. You can choose from a wide range of band line-up options as follows; 4-piece COMPACT - Lead female vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar / (Keyboards and Saxophone - one player). Limited setlist. 5-piece  STANDARD - Lead female vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar /  (Keyboards and saxophone - one player). 6-piece MIXED VOCAL - Lead female vocal / Lead male vocal /  Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar / (Keyboards and saxophone - one player). 7-piece - BRASSY - Lead female vocal  /  Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar /  (Keyboards and saxophone - one player) / Trumpet / Trombone. 8 piece - SELECT - Lead female vocal / Lead male vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar /  (Keyboards and saxophone - one player) / Trumpet / Trombone. 10 piece - HARMONY - 2 x Lead female vocal / 1 x Lead male vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar  / Keyboards / Saxophone / Trumpet / Trombone. 13 piece SHOW BAND - 3 x Lead female vocal / 2 x Lead male vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar  / Keyboards / Saxophone / Trumpet / Trombone / Percussionist. We have performed indoors / outdoors, at large festivals and in tiny spaces. We’ve performed abroad and we’ve travelled the length and breadth of the British Isles. *VENUE REQUIREMENTS - yes -we provide all necessary insurance and additional documentation upon request. We will fully liaise with your venue if preferred and reduce your workload a fair bit. *WE DON’T HAVE ANY SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS  -we can plug straight into the domestic 3 pin power sockets and we don’t require a stage (although it is nice if your venue can provide one!). All we ask is that you provide each band member with a hot meal if we are on site for over 5 hours. We have been together as a band for nearly a decade and in the unlikely event of any of the team falling ill, we can cover the part from our pool of fully rehearsed musicians. We have a dedicated and experienced manager who will work with you throughout the booking process and is always available to offer help & advice. How it works : Get in touch with us via the contact page on this site. Provide us with some details of your event, most importantly : location, date, performance times and preferred package details. We will confirm availability and quote you a price. Claire Marie Hall. 'Live and Upfront' (London Palladium), Sharon Cunetta (Wembley Arena), Champion Children (ITV). Amy Pearson. Platinum selling singer songwriter (The Prototypes, Zoe Badwi, Eddie Craig). Denquar. Residency, Hyatt Regency hotels (UK / Japan / Hong Kong), Leopard Bar, London. Gerad McArthur. Jason Donavan, Mike and the Mechanics and Deacon Blue. GeO Gospel Choir. Matt Holland Robbie Williams, Van Morrison, Lisa Stansfield. Grammy Award Albums (Ray Charles / Roger Daltry). Alessandro Taglioni. Diploma MUS, Teacher. Paul Narang. BA Music Hons Performance, Middlesex University. Francisco Bernhard. BA Music Hons Performance Munich School. Richard Cross Yehudi Menuhin, Vladimir Ashkenazy, Carl Davis and Katherine Jenkins, The Royal Academy of Music. Giles Narang. Former Bronzehead drummer, Toured with LCD Soundsystem. Antoine Sarkar. Royal College Music BA Hons Mus. Lycée College Voltaire. Andrew Simmons. Royal College of Music, London, MMus, Newcastle College, BAMusic (First Class). DJ DIESEL @ Vivid Music Hall | LineLeap Tickets DJ DIESEL @ Vivid Music Hall Shaq, Shaquille O'Neal, Diesel, DJ Diesel Dec 7, 2024 7:00 PM - 2:00 AM Vivid Music Hall • Gainesville • FL Event Description DJ DIESEL (SHAQ) delivers a nightmare before Christmas this December 7th in Gainesville! This event has happened. All sales have ended. Overview Vivid Sky Pres. DJ DIESEL! Venue: Vivid Music Hall Address: 201 W. University Ave, Gainesville, FL 32601 For any questions, group pricing or other service please contact us at: Email: info@vividskyvertical.com John: (561) 758 - 7628 Brandon: (561) 654 - 6798 Instagram: @VividSkyVertical & @VividMusicHall Facebook: Vivid Sky Vertical & Vivid Music Hall *To help rebuild our community, we are donating $2 from every ticket purchased for Hurricane Relief Efforts.* ________________________________________________________________________________________ Shaquille O'Neal, renowned as one of the most dominant NBA players in history, has also become a global entertainment icon. His passion for music began at 14 after seeing Public Enemy live, inspiring him to save for his first DJ equipment. In 1993, his rap album Shaq Diesel sold over a million copies, making him the first athlete with a platinum record. After discovering electronic dance music at TomorrowWorld in 2014, he launched his DJ career as DJ Diesel, collaborating with top artists like Steve Aoki and Riot Ten. Now, he headlines major festivals worldwide, runs his own event series, Shaq's Bass All-Stars, and holds a Las Vegas residency. Download the App Company Contact Us What is LineLeap? View All Events Latest News Events News Schools Show menu Back Music in Schools Our aim is to support schools to create the conditions where music thrives Find out more Planning Music in Your School Supporting Music in Your School Music Development Plan CPD and Training Funded Opportunities School Survey Contact Toggle search User Log in open mobile navigation Search for: Search Meet the team Professional, friendly, passionate From our ensemble leaders and teachers to administrators and managers, all Kent Music staff have one thing in common – a commitment to supporting you throughout your musical journey with us. Meet the non-teaching team below! You can reach us by emailing hello@kent-music.com We will forward your message to the relevant member of staff, who will be happy to help. Want to find out more about our teaching staff? Meet the teachers here . Kent Music Staff: Board of Trustees Our Board of Trustees is made up of dedicated professionals who guide and oversee Kent Music. They bring experience from education, arts, business, and community service, helping to shape our vision and ensure we provide excellent music education in Kent and Medway. Our Trustees are committed to fostering creativity, inclusivity, and excellence in all our programs. Meet our Trustees below and learn about the unique skills they bring to our organisation. Interested in Becoming a Kent Music Trustee? We are always on the lookout for passionate and dedicated individuals to join our Board of Trustees. If you have a love for music and a commitment to enhancing music education in Kent and Medway, we would love to hear from you. For more information or to have an informal conversation about becoming a trustee, please contact us at recruitment@kent-music.com Ray Mia Ray is a film, audio and theatre producer who has worked across the entire creative landscape from technology design and build through to production, delivery and distribution. Jessica Cooling Jessica is a freelancer working with choirs and orchestras in London and the South East, focussing in concert production and administration. Alicia Moyles Alicia is Head of Service, Specialist Employment at the Education People. Rebecca Evernden Rebecca is Director of Cross Cutting Policies & Negotiations for the Civil Service. Elizabeth Topiwala Elizabeth is a retired primary school Head Teacher who trained as a piano teacher and has a lifelong interest in music education. She was also Head Teacher at Wrotham Primary School and Stocks Green Primary School. Robin Hammerton Robin works as a freelancer in the music education sector. Until July 2016 he was the National Lead for Music for Ofsted. Kyle Siwek Kyle is a doctorate student at the University of Oxford, where he holds a Choral Scholarship at The Queen’s College, but he previously spent fourteen years participating in Kent Music’s County Groups, Summer Schools, and Music Centres. He studied for undergraduate and master’s degrees in History and Politics, and has also served as a governor of a secondary academy school and an independent school trust. At university, he has been involved in collegiate governance and student representation. Geoff Miles Chair Geoff is a former BBC TV producer who is now Chair of Maidstone TV studios. Geoff is also the Chair of the Business Development Group of the South East Local Enterprise Partnership and Chair of the Kent Enterprise in Business Awards. Tim Leates Tim is retired. Before retirement he was the Head of Finance and Administration at the ABRSM. Heulwen Finley Heulwen is a Talent Agent and Senior Music Executive. As an agent and member of the senior leadership team at leading talent and entertainment company UTA for 16 years (UTA acquiring The Agency Group in 2015), she played a crucial role in shaping the music department and London office. Specialising in Classical, Theatre, and Performing Arts, Heulwen founded a global division representing top-tier talent, including singers, bands, podcasters and children’s entertainment. Her accolades include induction into the Women in Music Awards: Roll of Honour by Music Week, being a finalist for Live Music Agent of the Year at the 2020 Music Week Awards and being featured on the Variety International Women’s Impact list. Heulwen was previously an artist manager of opera singers at IMG Artists. She was a Royal Albert Hall 150th Anniversary Ambassador and has been a Trustee of Kent Music since 2024. Interested in joining our team? Discover our current roles and join our passionate team by visiting our vacancies page. About Us — Vivid Music Home Media Setlists The Band Packages Gallery FAQ Contact Home Media Setlists The Band Packages Gallery FAQ Contact We Are Vivid Music VIVID IS THE GO-TO BAND for parties, weddings and corporate events.  We are a professionally managed, scalable and established event band. We have more great reviews, and a wealth of material for our customers to review. We genuinely love what we do and this is reflected in our fantastic performances across the UK and Europe. SO WHY BOOK WITH US? *SOUND QUALITY of the band is probably the most important thing to consider at your event and it often gets overlooked. However good the performers are, if the overall sound quality is poor, the vocals indecipherable and the distinction between the instruments non existent, it will be difficult to appreciate the music at all. Live sound will vary from the sound you listen to in promotional videos on your home / mobile devices, and different venues have different acoustic properties. We own and supply genuine industry grade equipment to all events and we have a qualified engineer band member to manage the sound setup. Sound and disco lighting production for events of up to 250 persons is included as standard with all our packages. Additional production is also available  (in-house and upon request). In addition to this, our 8-piece and above line-ups are all booked with an independent sound engineer. We own our own 9-seater tour bus so we are able to carry a good stock of spares and we can all travel to gigs together which is very healthy for the environment too! *OUR HUGE SONG REPERTOIRE of both classic and contemporary songs makes us a very appealing option to any potential client. We have also complied a collection of song medleys that form the basis of the repertoire that you can choose for your event (take a peak at the Setlists page for more details). Performance medleys give us the opportunity to perform many more songs than would otherwise be available to you within your performance period. We avoid unnecessary stops and starts between songs, and we maintain the momentum throughout the show. Modern music is heavily produced and we can recreate this with our genuine authentic reproductions using modern instruments and versatile effects units. *OUR EXPERIENCE is legendary. We have been trusted to perform at many high calibre events and for numerous high profile clients such as Mercedes UK, Shell Europe, R.A.F. Marriott Hotels, Guoman Hotels, The Natural History Museum, The Victoria & Albert Museum. Our singers have worked with producers such as Rodney Jerkins, Jimmy Harry, and Shelley Peikin, having contributed to original songs for artists such as Michael Jackson, Madonna, Beyonce, Whitney Houston, Ed Sheeran, and Kylie. *VIVID MUSICIANS AND VOCALISTS are a stellar collection of London's West End performers and industry professional musicians. All our singers are experienced West End show performers or have established, successful industry solo careers. All of our musicians are professional performers and all carry degrees from respected music schools.  We are all qualified in both jazz and pop disciplines. *ADDITIONAL SERVICE options are available to cover many other areas of your entertainment brief . We have 3 DJ selections as well as DJ sax live option. We provide instrumental and vocal-led acoustic / jazz band options, roaming bands, horn sections and multiple vocalist line-ups. We have additional production available for events over 250 persons and we can provide a mesmerising star cloth background to all clients. We can even supply a range of photo booths from our sister company Viivd Booths. *SAXOPHONE IS INCLUDED WITH ALL BOOKINGS. That’s right - whichever line up you choose, we provide a saxophonist as part of the band and to roam the dance floor if you wish! *CHOOSE YOUR LINE-UP. You can choose from a wide range of band line-up options as follows; 4-piece COMPACT - Lead female vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar / (Keyboards and Saxophone - one player). Limited setlist. 5-piece  STANDARD - Lead female vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar /  (Keyboards and saxophone - one player). 6-piece MIXED VOCAL - Lead female vocal / Lead male vocal /  Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar / (Keyboards and saxophone - one player). 7-piece - BRASSY - Lead female vocal  /  Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar /  (Keyboards and saxophone - one player) / Trumpet / Trombone. 8 piece - SELECT - Lead female vocal / Lead male vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar /  (Keyboards and saxophone - one player) / Trumpet / Trombone. 10 piece - HARMONY - 2 x Lead female vocal / 1 x Lead male vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar  / Keyboards / Saxophone / Trumpet / Trombone. 13 piece SHOW BAND - 3 x Lead female vocal / 2 x Lead male vocal / Acoustic drums / Guitar lead & rhythm / Bass guitar  / Keyboards / Saxophone / Trumpet / Trombone / Percussionist. We have performed indoors / outdoors, at large festivals and in tiny spaces. We’ve performed abroad and we’ve travelled the length and breadth of the British Isles. *VENUE REQUIREMENTS - yes -we provide all necessary insurance and additional documentation upon request. We will fully liaise with your venue if preferred and reduce your workload a fair bit. *WE DON’T HAVE ANY SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS  -we can plug straight into the domestic 3 pin power sockets and we don’t require a stage (although it is nice if your venue can provide one!). All we ask is that you provide each band member with a hot meal if we are on site for over 5 hours. We have been together as a band for nearly a decade and in the unlikely event of any of the team falling ill, we can cover the part from our pool of fully rehearsed musicians. We have a dedicated and experienced manager who will work with you throughout the booking process and is always available to offer help & advice. How it works : Get in touch with us via the contact page on this site. Provide us with some details of your event, most importantly : location, date, performance times and preferred package details. We will confirm availability and quote you a price. Claire Marie Hall. 'Live and Upfront' (London Palladium), Sharon Cunetta (Wembley Arena), Champion Children (ITV). Amy Pearson. Platinum selling singer songwriter (The Prototypes, Zoe Badwi, Eddie Craig). Denquar. Residency, Hyatt Regency hotels (UK / Japan / Hong Kong), Leopard Bar, London. Gerad McArthur. Jason Donavan, Mike and the Mechanics and Deacon Blue. GeO Gospel Choir. Matt Holland Robbie Williams, Van Morrison, Lisa Stansfield. Grammy Award Albums (Ray Charles / Roger Daltry). Alessandro Taglioni. Diploma MUS, Teacher. Paul Narang. BA Music Hons Performance, Middlesex University. Francisco Bernhard. BA Music Hons Performance Munich School. Richard Cross Yehudi Menuhin, Vladimir Ashkenazy, Carl Davis and Katherine Jenkins, The Royal Academy of Music. Giles Narang. Former Bronzehead drummer, Toured with LCD Soundsystem. Antoine Sarkar. Royal College Music BA Hons Mus. Lycée College Voltaire. Andrew Simmons. Royal College of Music, London, MMus, Newcastle College, BAMusic (First Class). In respect of personal information, Destination NSW advises that it collects, uses and stores any of your personal information strictly in compliance with the Privacy and Personal Information Protection Act 1998 (NSW) and the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth). For your information, our privacy policy is located at: https://www.destinationnsw.com.au/privacy-policy . Destination NSW may share your information with third parties including third party suppliers and operators conducting and administering the activity and other related activities, however your personal information will not generally be disclosed to anyone outside Australia, unless in connection with the activities. Where the information is shared with any countries in the European Union, Destination NSW will adhere to the data protection rules as per the General Data Protection (GDPR) Regulation. Information relating to this is also located within our privacy policy. You can opt out at any time by contacting Destination NSW.
